page.title: 03BEAFORD C.P. SCHOOL
page.content: The primary school was built in 1870 for children of the village. Since 1960 it has acquired extra wooden classrooms to accomodate children from Roborough and St. Giles villages, where the schools were closed. The numbers on roll in the summer of 1985 were 91 children, aged 5 to 11 years, plus 16 part-time nursery children. In 1984 another wooden classroom was installed. The school has a large playing field, part of Rye Parks field, used for sports, soccer and fetes. An active Parents-Teachers Association mounts several activities each year and supports the school with extra finance. The children from the other villages are bused to and from school, and on reaching the age of 11 years, children usually go on to Gt. Torrington Comp.
